Module schach
Package model

Class Figure

java.lang.Object
model.Figure
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, FigureStub, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Figure
extends java.lang.Object
The Figure class is the abstract parent class for our different figures.
Author:
Christin Krause, Jan Rehfeld, Sven Wolff

    Figure​(int l, int c, boolean color, char name)
    The constructor expects color and name of the figures.

  • Constructor Details

    • Figure

      public Figure​(int l, int c, boolean color, char name)
      The constructor expects color and name of the figures.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of a figure: 'true' = white and 'false' = black.
      name - The name of a figure as a single char: 'p' = pawn, 'r' = rook, 'n' = knight, 'b' = bishop, 'q' = queen and 'k' = King.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public abstract java.lang.String[][] move​(Tile[][] tiles, java.lang.String[][] movePossibilities, Position position, boolean checkTest)
      This method processes the movement possibilities of the figures.
      Parameters:
      tiles - The 2D board tiles of the game
      movePossibilities - The 2D board to see all possible moves
      position - The position of the figure.
      Returns:
      returns a String 2D array with true, false or enemy

    • getKingPos

      public Figure getKingPos​(Tile[][] tiles, boolean color)
      Finds the enemy king on the board.
      Parameters:
      tiles - The board with the figures.
      color - The color of the current figure.
      Returns:
      The enemy king.
